abstract.p: Letter from Peter Page agrees with Dr Bjorn Lomborg (Aug 7 article) that environment is not in dire condition

block.p: The zealots -- from Malthus to Carson and Ehrlich -- who inventory contemporary social ills, extrapolate over years or generations and pronounce the sum as the definitive human future should not be judged ''wrong'' without noting that their predictions galvanized public opinion into a persuasive demand for corrective action that, thanks to Dr. Bjorn Lomborg's scholarship, has proved hugely successful (''Eco-Optimism'').

The zealots -- from Malthus to Carson and Ehrlich -- who inventory contemporary social ills, extrapolate over years or generations and pronounce the sum as the definitive human future should not be judged ''wrong'' without noting that their predictions galvanized public opinion into a persuasive demand for corrective action that, thanks to Dr. Bjorn Lomborg's scholarship, has proved hugely successful (''Eco-Optimism'').
That said, shame on advocacy groups that bang the drum as if nothing has been achieved since Earth Day 1970 and double shame on the journalists who ought to know better.
Even if an apocalypse is not pending, there are many urgent reasons for achieving a renewable energy economy, pollution prevention and the rest of the environmentalist agenda.
